items.title: Minister defends taxpayer-funded trips as Coalition pushes for independent review
items.summary: The communications minister is not indicating she will pay back any money as she comes under renewed fire for the cost of taxpayer-funded trips.

items.title: The fake Indian wedding tying the knot between trend and tradition
items.summary: The global, growing and glamorous trend of South Asian weddings — sans bride and groom — has landed on Australian soil.

items.title: The 'everyday' behaviour that has shop owners in Australia worried — and it's on the rise
items.summary: As Christmas nears, increasing retail theft is costing profits and putting staff at risk. What's behind it?

items.title: 'A very painful day': India nightclub fire in Goa leaves 25 people dead
items.summary: A fire in a nightclub in India's tourist hot spot of Goa has killed 25 people.

items.title: Christmas lights return to Bethlehem for first time since Gaza war
items.summary: A giant Christmas tree adorned with red and gold baubles stands in the West Bank city of Bethlehem for the first time since 2022.

items.title: How a 'weaker' La Niña could impact Australia differently this summer
items.summary: La Niña is here, but not the one you're picturing. This year's event is shaping up to be "weak" — and the forecast points to a hotter, drier summer instead.

items.title: The first and only rule of 'Bite Club', the support group for shark attack survivors
items.summary: Being bitten by a shark or other predator can leave lifelong scars. One survivor started a club for those who've lived to tell the tale.

items.title: More than a dozen NSW homes lost as firefighters battle blazes amid extreme heat
items.summary: NSW Premier Chris Minns said it was a "challenging day for NSW firefighters".

items.title: First time since 1974: Australia's FIFA World Cup 2026 opponents revealed
items.summary: The most logistically complex World Cup in history will be held across the United States, Mexico and Canada from 11 June to 19 July.

items.title: Trump administration suggests US 'cultivate resistance' within Europe to 'current trajectory'
items.summary: US President Donald Trump's new national security strategy marks a radical departure from previous US policy.

items.title: 'Deeply concerned': Australia sanctions top Taliban leaders
items.summary: The federal government has similar sanctions in place for other countries, including Iran, Russia and North Korea.

items.title: What is the FIFA peace prize, and why was Trump selected as the inaugural recipient?
items.summary: Last month, FIFA announced that a new annual award called the FIFA peace prize would be presented at the draw.

items.title: Revealed: The travel hotspots Australians are heading to this summer
items.summary: Almost three-quarters of Australians will be heading on holiday this summer — but many are choosing to stay closer to home.

items.title: Australia’s social media ban to follow teens overseas — and hit visa holders
items.summary: As Meta starts enforcing the social media ban, uncertainty grows over how the rules may affect young visitors and international students.

items.title: 'I wish I was a dog in Australia': Ex-immigration detainee speaks out as scheme investigated
items.summary: The UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention is examining how the country deprives people of their liberty, from prisons to offshore detention facilities.

items.title: Israel to perform at Eurovision 2026 as Spain, Netherlands, Ireland and Slovenia withdraw
items.summary: Israel's participation has divided opinion in the contest, which has a history of entanglement in political rivalries and international issues.

items.title: Nation's top advocate for Indigenous kids joins chorus of condemnation for 'cruel' Victorian youth crime laws
items.summary: National Indigenous Children's Commissioner says Victoria's harsh new adult time for Violent Crime laws will fail First Nations kids.

items.title: US says there are opportunities to put AUKUS on 'strongest footing' after five-month review
items.summary: Defence Minister Richard Marles said on Thursday that Australia is "working through" the review, which has has not been made public.

items.title: Judge calls for heads to roll after Indigenous boy's name was provided to 2GB
items.summary: The disclosures are now the subject of a NSW parliamentary inquiry into the privacy of young people in the criminal justice system.

items.title: Uluru's Ayers Rock Resort sold to US-owned tourism company
items.summary: Land and buildings at the resort will be transferred to Traditional Owners, the Aṉangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara.

items.title: 'Worst job in politics': Vincent Tarzia steps down as South Australia's Opposition leader
items.summary: Tarzia is the third state Liberal to lose the leadership in as many weeks.

items.title: 'Force of arms': Putin makes strong Donbas threat, adding pressure on peace deal
items.summary: Putin's territorial demand is something that Ukraine has never given any indication it would accept.

items.title: The latest travel advice for Southeast Asia amid deadly storms, floods affecting millions
items.summary: Travel warnings remain in place for parts of Asia where locals say they have "lost it all" as they take stock of the damage.

items.title: What we know about the Trump-brokered DR Congo–Rwanda peace deal
items.summary: Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo have signed a US-brokered peace accord aimed at ending the long-running conflict in eastern DRC.
